catchgame

Class Ocean

  • java.lang.Object
    • catchgame.Ocean
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Ocean
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class generates, "gives away", and regenerates SeaCreatures. It has methods to create SeaCreatures, "give away" sea creatures, and regenerate SeaCreature populations until they each reach their max or "carrying capacity" populations.
    Author:
    Matt Roberts, Thanh Lam
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      private java.util.ArrayList<Shellfish> crabPopulation 
      private java.util.ArrayList<Shellfish> lobsterPopulation 
      private java.util.ArrayList<Shellfish> oysterPopulation 
      private java.util.Random rand 
      private double regenerationTimeInterval 
      private double relativeGrowthRate 
      private java.util.ArrayList<Fish> salmonPopulation 
      private java.util.ArrayList<Fish> tunaPopulation 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Ocean()
      If it is a new game, fills the Ocean to max population; otherwise it loads the saved ocean; regardless, it then starts regenerateOcean to populate Ocean with SeaCreatures (up to max population).

      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Instantiates the given number of cod and adds it to the codPopulation ArrayList

      Instantiates the given num of the given species of Fish and adds it to the given Fish population

      Instantiates the given num of the given species of Shellfish and adds it to the given Shellfish population
      void addABunchOfTuna(int numTunaToAdd)
      Instantiates the given number of tuna and adds it to the tunaPopulation ArrayList
      private void addFish(java.util.ArrayList<Fish> fishPopulation, FishSpecies species)
      Instantiates a Fish of the given species with an appropriate random weight and adds it to the given Fish population
      private void addShellfish(java.util.ArrayList<Shellfish> shellfishPopulation, ShellfishSpecies species)
      Instantiates a Shellfish of the given species with an appropriate random weight and adds it to the given Shellfish population
      private int determineNumberNewFishOfPopulationGrowth(double elapsedTime, java.util.ArrayList<Fish> oldPopulationAL, int speciesMaxPopulation)
      Determines the appropriate number of Fish organisms of a species that would come into existence given the given time interval, previous population, and the max population Ocean allows, using the general population growth formula found on Wikipedia.
      private int determineNumberNewShellfishOfPopulationGrowth(double elapsedTime, java.util.ArrayList<Shellfish> oldPopulationAL, int speciesMaxPopulation)
      Determines the appropriate number of Shellfish organisms of a species that would come into existence given the given time interval, previous population, and the max population Ocean allows, using the general population growth formula found on Wikipedia.
      java.util.ArrayList<Shellfish> ecxtractAndReturnABunchOfShellfish(ShellfishSpecies shellfishSpecies, int clientCurrentPopulation, int clientMaxPopulation)
      The public method that determines how many Shellfish the Ocean should extract and return, based on the plentifulness of the species in the Ocean compared with the plentifulness of the species in the client's program or screen
      private java.util.ArrayList<Fish> extractABunchOfFish(java.util.ArrayList<Fish> fishPopulation, int num)
      Extracts the specified number of Fish
      private java.util.ArrayList<Shellfish> extractABunchOfShellfish(java.util.ArrayList<Shellfish> shellfishPopulation, int num)

      private Fish extractFish(java.util.ArrayList<Fish> fishPopulation)
      Extracts a Fish of the given shellfishPopulation by removing it from the ArrayList and returning it
      private Shellfish extractShellfish(java.util.ArrayList<Shellfish> shellfishPopulation)
      Extracts a Shellfish of the given shellfishPopulation by removing it from the ArrayList and returning it
      private void fillOceanInitially()
      Fills the Ocean's populations to initial size by calling addABunchOfCod, addABunchOfSalmon, addABunchOfTuna, addABunchOfOyster, addABunchOfLobster, addABunchOfCrab, with the parameters of initial ocean population sizes given in Constants

      Gets random weight for Tuna between Constants.COD_INITIAL_WEIGHT_MIN and Constants.COD_INITIAL_WEIGHT_MAX)
      private double getRandomWeightForCrab()
      Gets random weight for Crab between Constants.LOBSTER_INITIAL_WEIGHT_MIN and Constants.LOBSTER_INITIAL_WEIGHT_MAX)

      Gets random weight for a Fish of the given species between the applicable min and max weights for that species
      private double getRandomWeightForLobsetr()
      Gets random weight for Lobster between Constants.LOBSTER_INITIAL_WEIGHT_MIN and Constants.LOBSTER_INITIAL_WEIGHT_MAX)
      private double getRandomWeightForOyster()
      Gets random weight for Oyster between Constants.OYSTER_INITIAL_WEIGHT_MIN and Constants.OYSTER_INITIAL_WEIGHT_MAX)
      private double getRandomWeightForSalmon()
      Gets random weight for Salmon between Constants.SALMON_INITIAL_WEIGHT_MIN and Constants.SALMON_INITIAL_WEIGHT_MAX)
      private double getRandomWeightForShellfish(ShellfishSpecies species)
      Gets random weight for a Shellfish of the given species between the applicable min and max weights for that species
      private double getRandomWeightForTuna()
      Gets random weight for Tuna between Constants.TUNA_INITIAL_WEIGHT_MIN and Constants.TUNA_INITIAL_WEIGHT_MAX)
      private void regenerateOcean()
      Adds SeaCreatures to Ocean by calling updateAllSeaCreaturePopulations growth formula every 5 seconds.
      private void updateAllSeaCreaturePopulations()
      Updates all the SeaCreature populations in ocean by calling updateCodPopulation, updateSalmonPopulation, updateTunaPopulation, updateOysterPopulation, updateLobsterPopulation, updateCrabPopulation
      private void updateCodPopulation()
      Updates the codPopulation by calling updateFishPopulation with the appropriate parameters
      private void updateCrabPopulation()
      Updates the crabPopulation by calling updateShellfishPopulation with the appropriate parameters
      private void updateFishPopulation(double elapsedTime, java.util.ArrayList<Fish> fishPopulationAL, int speciesMaxPopulation, FishSpecies fishSpecies)
      Updates the given Fish population of the given species by calling addABunchOfFish to add the appropriate number of additions according to determineNumberNewFishOfPopulationGrowth
      private void updateLobsterPopulation()
      Updates the lobsterPopulation by calling updateShellfishPopulation with the appropriate parameters
      private void updateOysterPopulation()
      Updates the oysterPopulation by calling updateShellfishPopulation with the appropriate parameters
      private void updateSalmonPopulation()
      Updates the salmonPopulation by calling updateFishPopulation with the appropriate parameters
      private void updateShellfishPopulation(double elapsedTime, java.util.ArrayList<Shellfish> shellfishPopulationAL, int speciesMaxPopulation, ShellfishSpecies shellfishSpecies)
      Updates the given Shellfish population of the given species by calling addABunchOfShellfish to add the appropriate number of additions according to determineNumberNewShellfishOfPopulationGrowth
      private void updateTunaPopulation()
      Updates the tunaPopulation by calling updateFishPopulation with the appropriate parameters

    • Constructor Detail

      • Ocean

        public Ocean()
        If it is a new game, fills the Ocean to max population; otherwise it loads the saved ocean; regardless, it then starts regenerateOcean to populate Ocean with SeaCreatures (up to max population).

    • Method Detail

      • extractAndReturnABunchOfFish

        public java.util.ArrayList<Fish> extractAndReturnABunchOfFish(FishSpecies fishSpecies,
                                                              int clientCurrentPopulation,
                                                              int clientMaxPopulation)
                                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        The public method that determines how many Fish the Ocean should extract and return, based on the plentifulness of the species in the Ocean compared with the plentifulness of the species in the client's program or screen
        Parameters:
        fishSpecies - the relevant species
        clientCurrentPopulation - the number of the species in the client's program or screen
        clientMaxPopulation - the highest population of the species the client's program or screen should hold
        Returns:
        the proper number of Fish extracted from the ocean, given the Ocean's state and the parameters of the method call
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown is the Ocean tries to extract more of a species than it has, but current implementation should avoid this

      • ecxtractAndReturnABunchOfShellfish

        public java.util.ArrayList<Shellfish> ecxtractAndReturnABunchOfShellfish(ShellfishSpecies shellfishSpecies,
                                                                         int clientCurrentPopulation,
                                                                         int clientMaxPopulation)
                                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        The public method that determines how many Shellfish the Ocean should extract and return, based on the plentifulness of the species in the Ocean compared with the plentifulness of the species in the client's program or screen
        Parameters:
        shellfishSpecies - the relevant species
        clientCurrentPopulation - the number of the species in the client's program or screen
        clientMaxPopulation - the highest population of the species the client's program or screen should hold
        Returns:
        the proper number of Shellfish extracted from the ocean, given the Ocean's state and the parameters of the method call
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown is the Ocean tries to extract more of a species than it has, but current implementation should avoid this

        Parameters:

        the extracted Fish
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown is the num to extract is greater than the size of the list

        private Fish extractFish(java.util.ArrayList<Fish> fishPopulation)
                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Extracts a Fish of the given shellfishPopulation by removing it from the ArrayList and returning it
        Parameters:
        fishPopulation - the population to extract from
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - thrown if the ArrayList is empty when the method is called

        Returns:
        the Shellfish extracted
        Throws:

      • fillOceanInitially

        private void fillOceanInitially()
        Fills the Ocean's populations to initial size by calling addABunchOfCod, addABunchOfSalmon, addABunchOfTuna, addABunchOfOyster, addABunchOfLobster, addABunchOfCrab, with the parameters of initial ocean population sizes given in Constants

      • regenerateOcean

        private void regenerateOcean()
        Adds SeaCreatures to Ocean by calling updateAllSeaCreaturePopulations growth formula every 5 seconds.

      • updateAllSeaCreaturePopulations

        private void updateAllSeaCreaturePopulations()
        Updates all the SeaCreature populations in ocean by calling updateCodPopulation, updateSalmonPopulation, updateTunaPopulation, updateOysterPopulation, updateLobsterPopulation, updateCrabPopulation

      • updateCodPopulation

        private void updateCodPopulation()
        Updates the codPopulation by calling updateFishPopulation with the appropriate parameters

        private void updateSalmonPopulation()
        Updates the salmonPopulation by calling updateFishPopulation with the appropriate parameters

        private void updateTunaPopulation()
        Updates the tunaPopulation by calling updateFishPopulation with the appropriate parameters

        private void updateOysterPopulation()
        Updates the oysterPopulation by calling updateShellfishPopulation with the appropriate parameters

        Updates the lobsterPopulation by calling updateShellfishPopulation with the appropriate parameters

      • updateCrabPopulation

        private void updateCrabPopulation()
        Updates the crabPopulation by calling updateShellfishPopulation with the appropriate parameters

      • updateFishPopulation

        private void updateFishPopulation(double elapsedTime,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<Fish> fishPopulationAL,
                                  int speciesMaxPopulation,
                                  FishSpecies fishSpecies)
        Updates the given Fish population of the given species by calling addABunchOfFish to add the appropriate number of additions according to determineNumberNewFishOfPopulationGrowth
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - the time, real or virtual, since the population was last updated
        fishPopulationAL - the population to be updated
        speciesMaxPopulation - the largest population the Ocean allows
        fishSpecies - the species to be updated

      • updateShellfishPopulation

        private void updateShellfishPopulation(double elapsedTime,
                                       java.util.ArrayList<Shellfish> shellfishPopulationAL,
                                       int speciesMaxPopulation,
                                       ShellfishSpecies shellfishSpecies)
        Updates the given Shellfish population of the given species by calling addABunchOfShellfish to add the appropriate number of additions according to determineNumberNewShellfishOfPopulationGrowth
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - the time, real or virtual, since the population was last updated
        shellfishPopulationAL - the population to be updated
        speciesMaxPopulation - the largest population the Ocean allows
        shellfishSpecies - the species to be updated

      • determineNumberNewFishOfPopulationGrowth

        private int determineNumberNewFishOfPopulationGrowth(double elapsedTime,
                                                     java.util.ArrayList<Fish> oldPopulationAL,
                                                     int speciesMaxPopulation)
        Determines the appropriate number of Fish organisms of a species that would come into existence given the given time interval, previous population, and the max population Ocean allows, using the general population growth formula found on Wikipedia.
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - the time interval, real or virtual, that is supposed to have passed
        oldPopulationAL - the population in question
        speciesMaxPopulation - the max population Ocean allows of that species
        Returns:
        the number of Fish of the given species that the population should have reproduced

      • determineNumberNewShellfishOfPopulationGrowth

        private int determineNumberNewShellfishOfPopulationGrowth(double elapsedTime,
                                                          java.util.ArrayList<Shellfish> oldPopulationAL,
                                                          int speciesMaxPopulation)
        Determines the appropriate number of Shellfish organisms of a species that would come into existence given the given time interval, previous population, and the max population Ocean allows, using the general population growth formula found on Wikipedia.
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - the time interval, real or virtual, that is supposed to have passed
        oldPopulationAL - the population in question
        speciesMaxPopulation - the max population Ocean allows of that species
        Returns:
        the number of Shellfish of the given species that the population should have reproduced
